# Apple-project
In this project I'll do something that is not for pro programmers
Dummy Apple.com

        <br class="hidden lg:inline-block">Streamlined tab bar
      </h1>
      <p class="mb-8 leading-relaxed">The new tab bar design takes up less space on the page and takes on the colour of the site you’re on, extending the web page to the edge of the window. Redesigned, floating tabs have been combined with the Smart Search field, with buttons streamlined into the More menu, giving you access to powerful Safari features with the click of a tab.</p>
    </div>
  </div>
</section>
<section class="text-gray-600 body-font">
  <div class="container mx-auto flex px-5 py-24 items-center justify-center flex-col">
    <img class="lg:w-2/6 md:w-3/6 w-5/6 mb-10 object-cover object-center rounded" alt="hero" src="https://www.trustedreviews.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/54/2021/06/WWDC-21-Universal-Control-920x516.png">
    <div class="text-center lg:w-2/3 w-full">
      <h1 class="title-font sm:text-4xl text-3xl mb-4 font-medium text-gray-900">Universal Control</h1>
      <p class="mb-8 leading-relaxed">A single keyboard and mouse or trackpad now work seamlessly between your Mac and iPad — they’ll even connect to more than one Mac or iPad. Move your cursor from your Mac to your iPad, type on your Mac and watch the words show up on your iPad, or even drag and drop content from one Mac to another.</p>
    </div>
  </div>
</section>
<section class="text-gray-400 bg-gray-900 body-font">

      <h1 class="title-font sm:text-4xl text-3xl mb-4 font-medium text-white">No setup required ?
      </h1>
      <p class="mb-8 leading-relaxed">Yes! Just put your devices next to each other and move your cursor seamlessly between them.</p>
